snippet: With download sales cooling after a decade of growth, streaming services like Spotify, Pandora and Apple’s new iTunes Radio have become the latest hope for the troubled music business.
abstract: Streaming music services like Spotify, Pandora and iTunes Radio have begun delivering billions of hours of music to millions of consumers, indicating systemic change for the beleaguered music industry; yet even as they have grown, companies have yet to turn a profit, finding that most consumers are loathe to pay for their services.
lead_paragraph: With download sales cooling after a decade of growth, streaming services like Spotify, Pandora and Apple’s new iTunes Radio have become the latest hope for the troubled music business.

headline.main: A Stream of Music, Not Revenue
headline.print_headline: A Stream of Music, Not Revenue
